title: Carrie Fisher and Debbie Reynolds' '20/20' Special: Seven Revelations From Todd Fisher
text:
PHOTOS: See Carrie Fisher and Debbie Reynolds' Incredible Bond Through the Years 
“I think it just sort of happened,” Todd said, when asked about Debbie moving in. “That was also a beautiful thing, that they could be together at that level. On your way out [of the house], you’d see how Mom’s doing.” PHOTOS: Biggest Celebrity Cheating Scandals Ever! 
2. In Carrie’s final hours, family members, including Debbie, got bedside time with the Star Wars star. “Things didn’t need to be said or done differently,” Todd said. “Things happened naturally.” He continued about the grief-stricken Singin' in the Rai n legend, “My mother had said, 'I don’t want to attend my daughter’s funeral.'… [While planning Carrie’s funeral], she said she wanted to be with Carrie. Within 30 minutes, technically, she was gone.” 
3. Only one week ago, Carrie “was at the top of her game,” Todd said, as the actress had been in England promoting projects, including her new memoir, The Princess Diarist . “She was excited about Christmas. Her favorite thing to do was give out gifts. She always had the most amazing things for everybody.” Debbie Reynolds and Carrie Fisher attend the 2011 Creative Arts Emmy Awards at Nokia Theatre L.A. Live on September 10, 2011 in Los Angeles, California. Jason LaVeris/FilmMagic 
4. Family members thought Carrie, upon arriving back in California, might pull through, though the Blues Brothers actress was in critical condition. “We thought we might be able to save her — that was in play for a little while. [It was] not a sure thing, by any means,” Todd said. Debbie knew, Todd said, that her daughter was fading. “[Debbie] felt she had already left the building, so to speak.” You May Also Like
